dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full moon rises over a white blanketed expanse of meado freshly dusted with powder.  In the distance, a dark wall pine rises into the crisp, blue-black night.  The landsca is serene, tranquil, needing only airborne reindeer to elevate it to Christmas card status.  Suddenly a young gi eight or nine years old, races into frame, LONG LENS STAC running for all she's worth.  Her hair is close-cropped, military buzz.  She wears only a nightgown, no shoes.  He bare feet blast through the snow as YOUNG MAX powers acro the open meadow. A SUNGUN xenon spotlight moves across the ground like a d ray, searching left and right among the trees. ANGLE ON A SNOW COVERED MEADOW as the xenon beam sweeps t trees nearby.  It passes on and the sound of the chopper fades.  Out of the treeline bursts the running figure. LONG LENS, WHIP PANNING with Max as she runs.  HEAR the s of her breathing, deep and regular, like a horse.  She ru like a machine, no stumbling, no wasted motion.  Her brea trails behind her in the frigid mountain air.  Closer now see her nightgown is actually a hospital gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The escape was not my idea.  I mean, escape to what?  We didn't know there was anything else. Max reaches the treeline just as the xenon spot sweeps ov again.  It slashes bright light through the branches, the moves away.  She looks up, taking deep, controlled breath then runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pack of snowmobiles are slashing through the trees, the engines whining, ridden by black-clad SOLDIERS wearing nightvision goggles and carrying rifles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max runs through a thicket of trees into a clearing.  Beh logs and tree trunks, several other children are conceale She joins them wordlessly, exchanging hand signals with t oldest boy, ZACK.  There are eight of them, all about Max age, except for two older boys.  They have the same sever haircuts.  Like Max, they are not dressed for the cold bu they don't seem affected by it.  We may notice that they have a curious looking mark on the back of their necks... bar-code. Another child makes it to the rally point...a girl, JONDY She joins Max and they clasp hands.  The children look ac the meadow, hoping to see more coming, but Jondy is the l They hear distant POPS of gunfire. The sound of the snowmobiles grows steadily louder.  Zack points at his wrist, an imaginary watch, and makes a slas sigh with his hand.  Out of time.  With vigorous hand sig he separates the children into escape-and-evade teams, tw a team.  Max and Jondy are paired.  The children's manner clipped, military and much older than their years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Zack who said we had to leave.  So I guessed he saved my life... And I never even got the chance to thank him. The kids nod perfunctorily to Zack and head off, running through the trees in their teams of two.  Max indicates s doesn't want to leave Zack alone but he reiterates the or with sharp hand signals.  Finally, Jondy pulls Max by the arm, leaving Zack, who scans the forest with bright, fera eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black-clad guards drag a struggling child who's been recaptured toward an imposing building, some sort of rese facility.  Somewhere an alarm wails. A figure, silhouetted by the lights of an approaching Hum The man raises a walkie with one hand, keeping the other buried in his pocket.  Security chief DONALD LYDECKER, 30 scans the dark forest as he speaks into the walkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Lydecker.  I want you to capture if you can.  But if any of them make it to the perimeter, you are to terminate. Is that understood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Confirming, Sir, you're giving an order ten-oh-six. Though it is more question than confirmation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take responsibility.  If they reach the outer fence...shoot to kill. Lydecker jumps into the Humvee as it pulls up next to him They roar off into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Jondy sprint through the trees.  They reach a chainlink fence topped with barber wire.  Jondy climbs a nearby tree, runs out along a limb.  She leaps out into space, plants her hands on the top row of the wire and do gymnast's vault over it, into a perfect dismount in the s Max follows. ANGLE THROUGH NIGHTVISION SCOPE...the thermal signatures the two girls at the fence look like luminous ghosts in a green landscape. TIGHT ON a trooper, scope to his eye, moving his finger t the trigger of his rifle. WHAM!  He is tackled from the side by a blurring shape. hits the ground and struggles to raise the weapon...seemi to go into slow motion as-- WHAP!  Zack knocks the weapon cartwheeling out of his han with a sweeping roundhouse kick, then swings a hunk of br branch like a Louisville Slugger.  The trooper drops and stays down. AT THE FENCE Max lands in a snowdrift on the far side, th spins around in a crouch as headlights hit her.  For a sp second her pupils flash with a green glow like a cat's ey Through the chainlink fence she sees black figures surrou Zack, silhouetted by the headlights of arriving snowmobil IN SLOW MOTION one of the troopers fires a tazer at Zack. Moving in real time (and thus much faster than the scene around him, which remains in slo-mo) Zack ducks the flyin tazer dart.  It embeds in a soldier behind him who is jum started by the 150,000 volts.  Zack smashes the tazer-fir guy with the log and leaps toward another when-- Five troopers fire tazers simultaneously and-- Zack ducks and spins, dodging, but-- One of the darts connects and he lights up, convulsing as Two more troopers run up and fire at close range and-- Zack goes down, making spasmodic snow angels. Max stares in horror as Zack is set upon by the human wol Jondy grabs her and yanks her away.  They sprint across a clearing and over a frozen pond toward the sheltering woo beyond.  The xenon searchlight rakes the trees near them. HEAR snowmobiles converging. Max, trailing Jondy by a few feet, drops suddenly as the beneath her gives way.  Jondy goes back to pull her out, lying on the ice and reaching out.  Max grabs Jondy's han but as she pulls herself up out of the hole, the edge bre away and Max falls back.  Jondy looks up at the sound of snowmobiles, and the xenon spotlight raking through the w toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on... GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  We stick together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, Jondy.  I'll find you. With that, Max takes a big gulp of air and disappears und the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max... But she's gone.  Jondy looks up to see soldiers running toward the fence.  Some of them kneel, raising their rifl Jondy sprints for the woods.  The xenon spotlight finds h KAPOW!  POW!  POW!  Snow explodes around her as the bulle whiz by.  She makes the treeline as bark is blasted off t trees next to her.  Jondy runs on, into the black woods. Humvees smash through the fence, followed by snowmobiles running men.  One of the Humvees stops next to the pond, Lydecker jumps out.  He is met by a LIEUTENANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got seven so far...three wounded, two killed.  And my men are taking a helluva beating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get them, Lieutenant.  It's your ass if one of them makes it to the outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realistically, Sir, it's ten degrees out here.  How far can these kids get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find them. Lydecker lights a cigarette, holding it in one bare hand. The hand which flicks the lighter is sheathed in a tight black leather glove.  He gets into the Humvee and goes. IN ON the ice where Lydecker had been standing.  Back-lit the eerie, blue-green glow of the sungun refracted throug the water we see--

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: underwater, her face pressed against the ice looking upwa very much alive, eyes wide with fear--

dialogues.speaker: THE SAME PAIR OF EYES
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to find Max, now a girl of eighteen.  Her brown eyes are piercing, her dark hair alive in the wind framin her beautiful face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes it seems like it happened to someone else.  Like maybe it was a story I heard... The hardest part is not knowing...if any of them made it.  If I knew for sure I was the only one left, it would be worse.  At least now I can make up lives for them... Like maybe Jondy's a fashion photographer...or an architect. The truth is they'd just be like me... living on the run, always looking over your shoulder. As we continue PULLING BACK we see that she is seated ato one tower of the Golden Gate Bridge, the city of San Francisco glimmering in the background.  How she got up there, we have no clue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope is for losers.  It's a con job people trip behind until they finally get a grip on the cold hard truth... But still I...hope they're out there, somewhere...some of them.  And that they're okay.

dialogues.speaker: OFF MAX
dialogues.text: staring into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXTREME CLOSE UP ON MAX, present day, her eyes shut tight flinching from the inner concussion of--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grainy, black and white images seen in EXTREME CLOSE UP, an almost abstract expressionist quality: A line of children, heads shaven, saluting.  Small feet i boots marching in unison.  There is only a roaring, rushi sound, and a kind of word-babble of distorted, amplified commands... PA speakers, megaphones.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: in the present, hugs herself and trembles as the images p through her head. FLASH CUTS... Young Max on a treadmill, wired and taped up with every k of sensing device and electrode, a tube taped in her mout running with intense concentration. TIGHT ON a pupil scanned by a laser.  Electrodes being attached to a scalp.  A needle rising against a surgical light.  TIGHT CUTS of abstract figures in medical smocks. faces. An instructor standing against a large screen, gesturing a pointer to a tactical diagram made up of organized boxe and acronyms.  TRACKING along bright young faces, taking in.  TIGHT ON graphics:  DUTY, DISCIPLINE, TEAMWORK. LONG LENS STACK of kids marching in rows in a tiled hallw wearing grey pajama-like fatigues, the bar-code tattoos o the backs of their necks visible as they strut past.  Sta of kids doing push-ups.  Kids punching in unison in a mar drill.  Young Max and another girl in fierce hand-to-hand combat training.  Max's face is a mask of ferocity as she attacks.  She punches hard and-- BANG!  A bathroom mirror slams shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, in color and present day, looking at herself, then glances down at her hand, which is shaking with a tremor. She clenches it into a fist and then bends to splash cold water on her face.  She uncaps some pills, pops two in he mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sucks? As she starts brushing her teeth. WIDE, showing Max's apartment and her roommate, KENDRA, w is wearing a long T-shirt and a hungover look, sipping coffee.  We see that the apartment is an unfinished build a luxury high-rise in the making until the day constructi simply stopped.  The walls are taped drywall, spray-paint with colorful undulating graffiti by somebody's old boyfriend.  This is where Max and Kendra have been crashi for the last several months.  Dominating the room are Max babies...her bikes:  an ugly but fast messenger bicycle.. a much faster rice-burner motorcycle with a race faring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I come home, it's three a.m., you're still out.  I feel like I got hit by a cement truck and you been up for an hour bouncing around.  That by definition sucks. Max swishes some bottled water and spits, wiping her mout with the back of her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made you coffee.  That oughta help you cope with the injustice of the world a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, it's starting to kick in. (another sip) I feel almost human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too. She studies herself in the mirror, her expression enigmat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max wheels her bike out of the apartment which has no doo only a piece of plywood which she slides across the openi Max has a big glazed jelly donut in her mouth, which she eat throughout the following scene.  The corridor is lit sunlight leaking in from outside.  No utilities.  No rent No problem.  As she makes her way along the corridor we H music and somewhere a TV blares the news.  She passes a y Chinese woman doing Tai Chi in a splash of sunlight from window.  Max stops at a doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock, knock. Inside is THEO, 30, his wife JACINDA, and their little bo OMAR.  Jacinda is putting first grade reading books into knapsack for Omar, who is dawdling with his breakfast.  T sits on the edge of the bed, hunched and pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi guys. (to Theo) Let's roll, hotshot. Theo looks longingly at his bicycle, leaning against the wall.  He coughs.  Jacinda flashes a worried look at Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta take a personal day.  Whatever it is I got, I'm bitin' it bad. He hugs himself, shivering visibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's payday, need me to pick up your check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the best, Maxie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, little bit, you're gonna be late for school.  Three more bites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But big ones. (to Max) Everything's a negotiation. Max winks at Omar, who winks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max squeezes out through a chain-link gate which is loose chained shut.  Behind her looms the unfinished building. ground floor is boarded up with plywood commandeered duri the night by some street artist for a mural of an anime-s boy wearing shades, collar up, blowing a puff of smoke in the open mouth of a beautiful, full-lipped, wickedly made anime-style girl.  Max hops on her bike and takes off wit powerful strokes down the street.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON MAX'S LEGS
dialogues.text: as she pumps the pedals of her bike, muscles flexing unde cafe au lait skin.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: breathing in a regular, easy rhythm as she power up a lon hill.  We get the sense that she is not working even clos capacity.  Nevertheless, she is flying, gracefully weavin among the cars and foot-traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Max pumps her bike through the streets bustling with activity.  A normal day in the city two decades from now. Things have changed by the year 2020, but in subtle ways. The skyline is the same, not transformed by gleaming megastructures.  There are no Jetson flying vehicles glittering among the high-rises.  It is a city frozen in time, stopped dead in the tracks of progress.  But it is from a deserted place.  On the contrary, the streets are alive than ever. Max bunny-hops a curb, side-skids around a tight corner a barrels down a split-lane between a bunch of sluggishly moving cars, mostly older models from around the turn of century, the last time people could afford to buy anythin They are primered and held together with tape and wire. of them have been retrofitted with alcohol fuel tanks.  A these beaters run the micromini commuter cars which came later-- little plastic pieces of crap which look almost l kids' toys, powered by motorcycle engines.  There are delivery boys on scooters, and big, new, hybrid-powered S with class-2 armor and tinted windows driven by gangsters their street muscle.  As always, gangsters are the only o prospering in hard times. A lot of people use bicycles as their primary form of transportation-- housewives, secretaries, businessmen.  T bike messengers, like Max, hate them more than the cars, because they clog the sidewalks and lanes between traffic with their slow wobbling. At major intersections, National Guard armored personnel carriers and Humvees squat ominously.  There are checkpoi throughout the city, with sand-bagged guard stations.  Th bored-looking soldiers stand around smoking, their assaul rifles slung casually.  They flirt with secretaries on th way to work, and talk to passing school kids.  Occasional they pull a car out of the line and shake the driver down going through the trunk and pulling his possessions out o the sidewalk.  It's bullshit, third-world martial law gon stale.  A way of life.  Just part of the landscape. Max brakes to a stop at a sand-bagged checkpoint.  She flashes the plastic ID clipped to her vest to a YOUNG SOLDIER, along with a too-big smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jam Pony Messenger. He smiles back and waves her through, checking her out as goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good one. Women and men stand listlessly in endless lines outside stores, waiting their turn to buy from the paltry selecti on the half-empty shelves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They used to say one nuclear bomb can ruin your whole day.  It was sort of a joke until the June morning those terrorist bozos whacked us with an electromagnetic pulse from eighty miles up... You always hear people yappin' on how it was all different before the pulse...land of milk and honey, blah blah blah, with plenty of food and jobs and things actually worked.  I was too young to remember so...whatever. Cops in heavy riot armor walk through the crowds and crui the traffic in patrol cars which have been retrofitted wi polycarbonate shields over the windows and kevlar armor panels over the doors.  Among those walking with purpose tides of homeless.  The high unemployment caused by the economic collapse has led to a homeless population not se since the Great Depression almost a century before.  They live in makeshift colonies under freeway overpasses, in abandoned cars and parking structures.  They've been livi there for years, some with a lot of creature comforts-- p putt generators running TV sets, that sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thing I don't get is why they call it a depression.  I mean, everyone's broke but they aren't really all that depressed... Life goes on.

dialogues.speaker: RACK FOCUS
dialogues.text: from Max as she passes to a young mother, who lives in a gutted car, sending the kids off to catch the school bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An overhead fluorescent flickers.  This is the nerve cent of JAM PONY X-PRESS, San Francisco's oldest messenger service, founded sometime in the early years of the 21st Century.  The crew of messengers, mostly in their 20's, o various ethnicities, includes SKETCHY, DRUID, A.K.A., et They drink coffee and half-watch an ancient TV hung from ceiling while they wait for assignments.  HERBAL THOUGHT, 30's, full-dressed Rastaman, stoned (it being 9:15 alread bums tobacco and rolling papers from Sketchy as he makes case to a very pissed boss, NORMAL, 40's, beefy, so-named because he's always pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody there to sign for it, mon.  What's a bruddah s'posed to do, ride around all day with the damn package?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you just decided to return it to the sender.  Or, in this case, the sender's wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like de prophets say, "Only the unrighteous husband sends expensive gift- wrapped underpants to another woman." Normal heads behind the shipping counter which is clutter with packing slips, mailing tubes, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is none of your business...or mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods assent) It concerns only Jah.  But, in this case, I was the instrument of the Most High.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well around here, I'm the Most High... From now on, before you do anything, call in for instructions. In b.g. PICK UP and STAY WITH Max, who enters on her bike ignoring the sign which reads:  YOUR BIKE IS TO RIDE NOT BRING INSIDE.  Normal's reaction suggests this is a habit he's given up trying to break her of.  He shoves a packag Herbal just to get rid of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a hot run.  Beat it. (to Max) You're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was on call. (indicates her pager)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you on call here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the difference if I'm on call here or deployed in the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More like deployed in bed asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't sleep... Theo asked me to pick up his check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Theo can't pick up his own check because?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout you don't break my sneakers on this.  The guy is seriously not well. Max just looks at him.  Finally, Normal relents, reaches a drawer, hands her a pay envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell Theo he's not in tomorrow he can start looking for another job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how to break this to you, Normal, we're all looking for another job. Max crosses to a row of lockers where her home girl, ORIG CINDY, Black, 22, dressed in leather, stiletto nails, ghe fabulous, slams her locker shut, pissed off.  Max regards a beat then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Sunshine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught some son-of-a-bitch stealing my bike.  Used a car jack to blow out my U lock and bent a bunch of spokes.  So now I gotta get my wheels fixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least he didn't swing with your ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I broke a nail giving him a cranium crack and that just sort of wrecks your day, know what I'm saying? She looks over as NATALIE, clean cut, 20, arrives, crosse her boyfriend Sketchy and presents him with a box of cook and a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, why can't I find a girlfriend like that?  Brings him lunch everyday, thoughtful, sweet, legs from here to there--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shame, wastin' a girl like that on a guy, but what're you gonna do? Sketchy approaches, proffering the box of cookies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homemade.  Natalie baked them for our anniversary.  The big one-oh. As Max dives in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big one-oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went on our first date ten months ago tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. Original Cindy and Max exchange a look, then Original Cin heads off, passing a--

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: as the regular programming turns to snow, replaced after moment by the pixelated image of the pirate cyber-journal known to the masses as "EYES ONLY."  As someone cranks up volume, PAN around the faces in the room who listen in ra attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on screen) Do not attempt to adjust your set.  This is a Video Free America bulletin.  The cable hack will last exactly sixty seconds.  It cannot be traced, it cannot be stopped, and it is the only free voice left in this city...

dialogues.speaker: SKETCHY EYES ONLY
dialogues.text: Is this guy for real?            (on screen) There are certain men who move through the world with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX                  impunity.  Their actions, no (bored skepticism)        matter how vile, are immune Who knows...                 from consequence.  Edgar Sonrisa is such a man.  You've seen him smiling at political

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRUID                fund-raisers, sitting at the He ever been wrong           Mayor's table drinking about anything?              champagne.  He owns shopping centers, a trucking company and the largest medical

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX                  supply company in San You ask me, he's on the      Francisco.  He also runs dru hustle same as everyone      and guns up and down the wes else.                        coast.  He's very publicly, very obviously dirty.  But he has never been arrested...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone shushes her.         never indicted.  Journalists who have attempted to expose him have been gunned down in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRUID                the street.  Their blood is Doesn't mean he's not        the ink of our modern news. telling the truth.           Those who've opposed him hav vanished... All of that is about to change...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't mean he is. Max turns and heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hope Jah's looking out for his ass 'cause he's messing with the brimstone, bruddah. Off which--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Sketchy are stopped at a light together.  Max practices balancing her bike at a dead stop, seeming to d gravity, staying upright without a foot on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major negativity heading this-a-way. Off Sketchy's nod Max glances up at--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six clean-cut, young kids walking abreast on the sidewalk little too clean-cut... They're STRAIGHT EDGE KIDS, the American equivalent to Islamic fundamentalists, only with buzz cuts, wife-beater T's, tats, chuks, etc.  They shove aggressively through the crowd.  Ahead of them, two teena are making out on a bus bench, lip-locked and oblivious. Straight Edgers grab them and start beating the shit out them.  Nobody intervenes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone oughta drop a little science on these straight edge idiots. Max's expression is stony, her eyes cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not my problem...or yours. The light changes and Max is gone.  Sketchy hesitates, th goes after her.  Max strokes along in high gear, rocketin between the cars.  Sketchy can barely keep up. About three stories up, a police HOVERDRONE scans the str below as it glides between the buildings with an annoying whine.  It looks like a flattened flying donut, two feet across, painted PD blue-and-white, with a ducted rotor in middle.  It is bristling with antennae and cameras-- visi range and infrared.  As it sails across some of the lower rooftops, we see a lot of jerry-rigged solar panels where people are trying to cope with the constant brown-outs an blackouts. Hearing the drone overhead, Max pulls her ball-cap down a little lower.  She doesn't want to wind up on the surveillance monitors at headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch you back at the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. Sketchy waves, peeling off at an intersection to go south Max powers on. She passes through the stalls of a street market where al manner of junk and homegrown produce is hawked.  The econ is half barter these days.  Stall owners loudly hawk expi canned goods, military MREs, backyard carrots, surplus parachute silk, ammo, or flour bulked out with spirulina the government tank farms. Max smokes down the hill between the stalls.  She puts tw fingers to her lips and whistles shrilly.  Ahead, a stall owner, BEN, looks up to see her coming and fires a tomato toward her as she passes. Across forty feet of crowded street, at a full clip, Max catches the tomato with one hand, calls--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit you back later. The stall owner turns to his wife and chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never seen her miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max pulls up in front of a building in the old financial district.  She hops off and pulls a pin in the frame of h bike, folding it double.  Then she hefts it onto her shou and walks into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max walks up to the GUARD at the desk behind a mesh-steel cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delivery...1906.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No bikes in the elevator. Wordlessly, Max jams it at him, all attitude, then locks to the cage and walks toward the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max rides up in a glass elevator with a good view of the high-rise district in b.g.  The inside of the elevator gl is scarred with graffiti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was s'posed to be the financial district, back before the banks closed. America really thought they had it dialed in-- money hangin' out the ass.  But it was all just a bunch of ones and zeros in a computer someplace.  So when that bomb went KA-BLOOEY and the electromagnetic pulse turned all the ones and zeros into plain ol' zeros, everyone's like "no way."  Now America's just another broke ex-super power looking for a handout and wondering why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max hands the envelope to a secretary who signs the recei Max's eyes rove the room, alert.  Scanning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max exits the suite and pauses by the window at the end o the corridor.  Something catches her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: her eyes scanning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building next door, another high-rise a few floors shorter.  It appears to be abandoned but Max's attention focuses on the tenth floor balcony where several security camera track slowly back and forth.  She sees movement... human figure...behind the dark glass of one of the window Max walks back along the corridor.  She looks around and, with no-one in sight, ducks through the emergency stairwe door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max moves fluidly down the stairs, her body-English transformed into something feral...catlike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The steel fire door opens and Max emerges.  She looks ale up and down the loading dock at the back of the building, then opens her fanny pack and takes out a small roll of packing tape, which she uses to compress the latch.  She back inside, closing the door, which now is not locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max emerges from the elevator and claims her bike from th guard station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later. The guard buzzes her out and she crosses the lobby, keepi her head tilted slightly down so her hat bill blocks her from the surveillance cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gathering place for bike messengers from all over the city.  This is where they hang out, play hacky-sack, smok cigarettes, score dope, etc.  Max glides up to Sketchy wh sitting cross-legged atop the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 's up. Sketchy nods across the street where an SUV, a gangster r with tinted windows, is parked outside a Chinese restaura A mob enforcer stands guard outside the door.  Inside, we another gangster holding the owner's hand over a fry-o-la full of boiling canola oil.  The enforcer barks his deman We can't quite make out the words but it's clear what's g down.  The restaurant owner, an Asian man in his 50's, pl for mercy while his terrified wife, unable to take it anymore, rushes to retrieve a wad of cash from a cabinet. Outside on the sidewalk, a uniformed cop walks past.  The commotion inside draws his attention, but seeing the enfo guarding the door, who nods, the cop hurries on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fog City's finest. Max looks at her watch, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quitting time.  Grab a cold one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta meet Natalie for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, the big one-oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'll take a rain check... He smiles and pedals off.  STAY WITH him.  But as soon as rounds the corner, he stops at a pay phone, looks to make sure the coast is clear, then dials.  After a beat, into phone--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk to Natalie? (then) You're not going to believe this.  I'm walkin' out the door and my idiot boss sticks me with a delivery way the hell out in the East Bay somewhere.  So I'm not gonna be able to make dinner... I know it's not fair... I begged, I pleaded, I pissed, I moaned, but I gotta do what I gotta do... We'll do something special, I promise... I love you too. Mousetrap.  Kisses. He hangs up, locks his bike to a pole, bolts up the steps a townhouse across the street and rings the doorbell.  Af a moment LYDIA MEYERSON, late 40's, appears at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late but-- She silences him, planting a big wet one on his mouth.  O Sketchy in the arms of another women, as the door closes-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: END OF ACT I ACT II

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city's bike messenger hang.  LAMAR, long, stringy hai big gut, bigger mouth, works the bar.  A big-screen TV dominates the room, playing a continuous loop of car, motorcycle, and truck crashes.  Seated at the bar along w several of their pals, including Druid, Max munches nacho while Original Cindy collects bets from assorted on-looke then to Druid--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You in? Druid coughs up some bills.  Original Cindy looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else? As Lamar approaches with drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the action?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max can repeat a fourteen-digit phone number by listening to the beep tones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not impressed) Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On speed dial. (seeing he's intrigued) Buy-in's ten. Lamar pulls out a bill and pushes it at Original Cindy, w looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last chance... (no takers) Okay.  Let's do it. The bar falls quiet.  All eyes are on Max as Lamar puts t telephone on the bar, hits the speaker button.  The sound the dial tone seems to fill the room.  Max, all concentration, closes her eyes.  A beat, then Lamar hits speed dial button and we HEAR a rapid-fire series of beep tones.  Max opens her eyes as the CAMERA pushes in on her then equally rapid-fire--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven-Nine-Six-Five-Seven-Three-Eight-One- Four-Two-Four-Six-Nine-Five. Druid looks at the phone's display, sees she's correct, t frustrated and amazed--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do that? Max coolly extends an open palm and collects her winnings

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have a beer...since you're buying. Max turns, sees DARREN McKENNEN, early 20's, too good looking, her ex, judging from the lukewarm response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't. She pockets the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're ya doin', Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean until you showed up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores her) You're not still pissed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I be pissed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a complicated situation which could have been misconstrued, causing you to maybe take offense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause you went out the back door and nailed her girlfriend?  Who would take offense to that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justine was not an unwilling participant. An observation that buys him zero rhythm with the women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know why I went after Justine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to have a relationship with you, Max, is like standing in a fog bank.  You know you're in the middle of something only you have absolutely no idea where you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when the fog lifted, there's Darren with his head under Justine's skirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Could you give us a moment. Original Cindy moves off, then to Max--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was crazy about you...am crazy about you.  But you keep everyone at arm's length like there's some great big dark something going on that-- I don't know... It's just that the more I tried to get close to you, the more you pulled away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really glad we're having this conversation.  You're right.  I was angry at you.  But talking about it-- The scales have fallen from my eyes and I see now that it was all my fault.  Can you ever forgive me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see the perimeter defense system is still fully intact... At least I tried. He goes.  Original Cindy drifts back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craps all over everything and everyone and then wants mommy to forgive him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) What guys do. (to Lamar re: nachos) 'Nother order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're way more philosophical than I could ever be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't go in with any expectations. Just then Natalie approaches looking around the room for boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys seen Sketchy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought he was having dinner with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had to bail at the last minute on accounta some emergency run.  Thought maybe he stopped by here on the way home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't seen him.  But if we do--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope he's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He probably just got stuck in traffic or something. Natalie nods, moves off continuing her search.  Max consi this a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's odd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? But Max shrugs it off, diverted by the arrival of the nac and is onto her next thought as she dives in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me the truth.  Am I a female fog bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not seriously buying into Darren's nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without conviction) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was just trying to blame you 'cause he's a slut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wanting to believe this) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah.  There's not the slightest grain of truth in anything that idiot was saying.  You are a totally down-ass female and a straight-up friend who happens to be a little...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I knew what you were saying, I wouldn't be asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you and me known each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long enough for you to pretty much read me like a book, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're probably my closest friend in the whole world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And back at ya.  Only there's a part of you that's... I don't know--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fog bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More like a mystery... Which isn't bad. It's just kinduv...mysterious... Max's pager goes off, she checks the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a secret. Max heads off, Original Cindy watching her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max hauls ass through the sparse traffic on her rice-burn motorcycle.  She slows in the neon glare of a row of ratt storefronts.  She turns in at a laundromat, hopping the c and driving her motorcycle right through the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max purrs the bike to the back of the place, bathed in a fluorescent glare which makes her skin cyan and pallid. heavyset woman of indeterminate age watches her warily, b doesn't break rhythm as she folds clothes.  Max jumps off kickstands the bike.  She walks through a door in the bac into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short, dingy corridor leads to the lit-up office of a laundromat manager, DAN VOGELSANG, who also runs a privat detective business out of the place.  Max pushes the door open and walks in, catching Vogelsang mid-bite in a meatb sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you to keep that thing outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drive away business roarin' in like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, does kinda break the elegant atmosphere you got goin' on here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a punk-ass mouth on you, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's not kid.  It's client.  As in the person who pays for your opulent lifestyle.  Now, you got something for me or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here someplace. He goes through some piles of printouts, then pulls one o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a hit on the car.  An oh-five Tahoe, blue, with Wyoming tags... AGT349... It wasn't easy 'cause you were off in one of the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I was seven at the time.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: as headlights flash into the lens, silhouetting Young Max running across the road, barefoot on an icy highway.  She freezes in the lights as the car skids up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she stands panting, wreathed in her own breath, her ha matted with ice.  She looks terrified...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO PRESENT
dialogues.text: Max coolly scans the printout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this guy?  This isn't who we're looking for...her name was Hannah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got the car in a trade for his old pick-up and some food...no bill of sale or nothing.  It was right after the pulse so all the DMV records were wiped.  So we don't get anything on the seller.  Except I actually managed to find this guy, six hours on the phone... Say thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he got it from a woman.  Doesn't remember her name but she fits the description you gave like a glove.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: throwing open the door to a blue SUV.  The woman, HANNAH, dressed in a medical uniform, like a nurse or lab technic She looks anxiously back down the road as if she is being followed, then yells--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in!  Hurry, come on! Young Max hesitates, clearly not knowing if she can trust woman's intention.  Finally, her bare feet slap the froze asphalt as she runs toward the car.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO PRESENT
dialogues.text: Max is leafing through Vogelsang's notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy says he made the trade in Gillette, Wyoming sometime in the fall of oh-nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?  That's it.  That's all I got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing on Hannah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nuclear airburst wipes out every record of every kind in every computer east of the Rockies, and you want me to find some woman you met when you were seven, whose last name you don't even know... Maybe if you could give me something more on her...anything you can remember, some detail...

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: crouched under the dash of the Tahoe.  Light and shadow p across her eyes as she looks up at the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah, seen from below.  Her face is hit by flashing red blue lights.  A siren wails past, going the opposite direction.  Hannah anxiously watches it recede in the rearview.  She look down at the child curled up on the fl manages a smile, then reaches down and puts a comforting on her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was a nurse.  She must've lived near there, somewhere, near the... (she pauses) ...the clinic.  There must be some registry of nurses or medical technicians or whatever for Wyoming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a last name would be nice.  Or the nearest town to this...clinic. Max glances away.  The hopelessness of her quest hangs in air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the other kids?  You get anything on them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't exactly have a search engine for finding a bunch of kids with bar- codes on their necks, which is something I'm not even going to ask about--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were gonna run through the law enforcement databases for a match on identifying marks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing so far from arrests, hospital admissions or coroners.  This kind of search...it's heavy spadework.  I'm gonna need--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More money... Like I'm shocked to hear you say that.

dialogues.speaker: MAX'S BIKE TIRE
dialogues.text: slides to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: THE WHEEL LOCKS
dialogues.text: CLACK as they close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: taking off her black glasses.  A distant car headlight sw her and Max's pupils glow for a split second with a green retinal reflection, like that of a cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Max looks up into the night shadows of an alley betwee high-rises.  She steps off the bike in one lithe, perfect balanced move.  She is wearing skin-tight black pants, bl rubber-soled high-tops, a black leather jacket and black gloves.  She is a silhouette in the darkness.  She hefts black nylon gear bag over one shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON DOOR LATCH
dialogues.text: The one Max taped over earlier in the day, as she pulls t door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max enters the dark emergency stairs like an inky shadow. She bounds up the stairs with the fluidity of a cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it is quickly taped over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Max emerges through the roof door and disables the roo security camera with a piece of black tape over the lens. She crosses to the edge overlooking the alley.  The stree twenty-two stories down.  Nearby is the high-rise she stu earlier in the day.  Her target is a narrow roof formed b setback in the facade of the next building...one hundred below her and eight feet away horizontally.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON THE GEAR BAG
dialogues.text: as it is unzipped.  Max's gloved hands yank out a large bundle of black nylon rope. CLICK! as a carabiner is snapped around a steel pipe. TIGHT ON MAX'S FEET as she steps up onto the parapet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Max stands at the edge of a 250 foot drop then dives headfirst out into the emptiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she plummets down the face of the building.  She adds pressure to the belay around her waist, then inverts with snap, dropping feet-first now, the rope making a SSSSHHHH sound across her leather jacket.  Max now builds lateral speed across the face of the glass high-rise.  She reache the bottom of the arc, the rope stretching, taking the sh and her lateral speed wipes the world into a blur. Max arcs upward, starting to slow.  As she flashes above parapet of the target rooftop, she releases the belay and lets the rope slide through her arm, dropping onto the rooftop with a soft thump.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON SKYLIGHT
dialogues.text: as Max jimmies the latch and lifts the cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apartment is spacious, with uptown architectural touc A cattail of black rope drops down, tickling the traverti floor.  Max slides quietly to the floor and freezes in a crouch.  Listening.  Nothing. She goes to work, padding silently through the apartment. She opens drawers, looks inside cabinets, picking up obje and examining them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max enters silently, hefts a small porcelain figurine, 17 Century Venetian.  She slips it into her bag.  A pair of small, gold dolphins follow.  Max hears something, goes t investigate--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man talking.  Strokes on a computer keyboard.  The wall are bathed in a blur CRT glow as Max slips the door open few inches and looks into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man sitting at a bank of computer monitors, half a doze screens, racks of computer gear and peripherals of all descriptions.  The room is dark, excepts for the glow of screens and power lights winking on the equipment.  Hapha heaps of papers, photos, files, and printouts are piled everywhere on expensive antique tables and couches.  The LOGAN CALE, is speaking directly into a video camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes Only cannot be bought or threatened. And through the Eyes Only informant net, a truth-speaker has come forward. Max can't see Logan's face directly because his back is turned, but she can see him in one of the monitors--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late 20's with intense, almost haggard, yet strikingly handsome features.  His eyes blaze with intelligence and projects a fierce energy as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The testimony of one fearless witness will soon lead to an indictment of Edgar Sonrisa for multiple counts of murder. Max registers surprise as she realizes who this guy is-- pirate cyber-journalist "Eyes Only," in the flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on video) The drug cortodiazapine is expensive, in short supply and much sought after as a cancer treatment.  It is shipped to veterans' clinics to treat the Balkan War Syndrome, a disease which is otherwise fatal. Logan scrolls back through the video he has just digitize and hits a key command which processes the image through masking filter.  Pixelation blurs the contours of his fac leaving only the intense eyes clear.  He watches it to ch that the effect is complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on video) Sonrisa has been replacing the federal drug shipments with sugar pills, selling the real cortodiazapine on the Canadian black market for two thousand dollars a bottle.  What fuels the demand?  The belief that cortodiazapine could slow the effects of aging when taken in large doses. Max backs out the door and stops as she sees something. table just inside the room, is a statue, an Egypto-deco affair of gold and onyx depicting a creature half-female, half-cat.  It's illuminated from above by a single pin-po of light.  Max just looks at it, utterly transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on video) There is no hard scientific evidence to support these claims.  But that doesn't stop Edgar Sonrisa from peddling this drug to the few wealthy, privileged foreigners who can afford to pay any price for vanity's sake. Seeing Logan's engrossed in his work, Max moves toward th statue, snags it and backs out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on video) Edgar Sonrisa gets richer while combat vets exposed to the genetically- engineered bio-war agents go untreated. All over this city, they are repaid for defending this country by being allowed to waste away and die...a slow, agonizing death...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stuffs the statue in her bag and heads back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A security guard, PETER, has found the rope.  He flicks h Maglite up to the open skylight and his eyes go wide.  He unholsters his 9mm, scanning and listening around him.  H crosses to the alarm panel near the door and punches in t silent alarm code.

dialogues.speaker: FOYER AND CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: as Max approaches.  The guard is scanning in the shadows, gun sweeping the room as he moves forward...and Max is mo down the hall toward him on a collision course.  She can' see him approaching the corner from the other side, but w can.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON MAX
dialogues.text: as she senses something on a level you and I never could. sound, a vibration...the guard's body heat perhaps.

dialogues.speaker: OVER THE GUARD
dialogues.text: as he approaches the corner.  He pops around the wall and aims his gun down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corridor is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max backs away from the closed door and quickly crosses t room as quietly as she can.  She reaches the door to an adjoining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max slips through the door quietly, but suddenly stops. only by a nightlight, a woman is lying on a bed with a yo girl of about 10, having just tucked her into bed.  This LAUREN BRAGANZA and her daughter SOPHY.  Lauren looks up, locking eyes with Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!  In here!  IN HERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHHH!  Don't do that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan hears the cries, shoves aside a pile of papers and grabs a pump shotgun.  He chambers a round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security guard breaks into a run, heading for the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauren grabs a lamp and hurls it with all her strength at Max. In SLOW MOTION the lamp tumbles end over end.  The guard flings open the door, sweeping his gun toward Max, all in SLOW MOTION...except Max, who is moving much faster, thou normal to our eye, whereas everyone and everything else appears as if underwater. Max easily ducks the lamp, which is just shattering again the wall as the guard takes aim with a two-handed grip. room goes dark as the lightbulb explodes. Max moves sideways before the guard can pull the trigger. BLAM!  The room strobes with the shot but the bullet goes where Max was, not where she is now...halfway to the guar moving like a freight train. BLAM!  A second shot...but Max has seen the intention and jinked again.  The bullet carves the air next to her.  Sh reaches the guy and gets a hand on the gun, yanking it do and around in a sweeping roundhouse which twists it out o his hand. This guy is big, 6'3" and 250 lbs., mostly muscle, except that paunch.  Max follows through with a footsweep takedo and drops onto the guy hard with his arm twisted behind h back. Max unloads the pistol, sliding out the magazine and jack out the chambered round.  She throws the gun one way and mag the other. BACK TO NORMAL SPEED, the guard struggles to move but Max drops onto him knee first again, knocking the wind out of for awhile.  Max looks up at the terrified mother and the crying little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. She bolts out the door into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sprints down the hall.  Suddenly, Logan appears in fr of her with the shotgun leveled at her.  It has a built-i mini-xenon light and it is blinding her nightvision, maki it hard to see exactly where he is aiming.  She is at a momentary disadvantage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it down. Max sets her bag gently on the floor.  Logan calls to Lauren--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes riveted on Max) Lauren...are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the guard) Peter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's the side of beef with the walkie- talkie, he's okay but he'll be awhile. Logan sees the statue peeking out of the open bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a thief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl's gotta make a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved, even amused) Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First time I ever heard that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was expecting someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off the shotgun) Guess it wasn't the pizza delivery guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky.  I almost pulled the trigger. Lauren is hanging back in the bedroom doorway with her cr daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry if I caught you at a bad time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just a little tense right now... (to Lauren) It's okay. They withdraw, then to Max re: the statue--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have good taste.  French, 1920's, attributed to Chitarus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what, you liked it because it was shiny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, because it's the Egyptian goddess Bast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The goddess who comprehends all goddesses, eye of Ra, protector, avenger, and destroyer, giver of life, who lives forever... I could keep going. Logan just looks at her, fascinated.  Then, Peter emerges from the bedroom, holding his ribs.  He fumbles out his handcuffs and heads for Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay back, Peter. Too late.  Max moves like lightning, grabbing Peter's wri as he reaches for her, yanking him off balance and gettin him in a sharply painful come-along hold with one hand be up behind his back.  Max has maneuvered him between her a the shotgun, trumping Logan's hold over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'd love to hang and discuss art but I gotta get going. She marches Peter backwards into the living room, control the big bodyguard with the thumb-hold and keeping him bet her and Logan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaah!  Aaaah!  Easy, my wrist is gonna snap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That could happen. (to Logan) By the way, I love your show. At that moment there is a thundering crash at the front d Max's head snaps around as a squad of private security co wearing ballistic armor haul back and pound the door agai with a steel battering ram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K-WHAM!  The doors are blasted open and a phalanx of heav armed rent-a-cops spill inside, their flashlights sweepin the apartment. SLOW MOTION as they raise their weapons toward Max. But Max is moving like grease lightning, as she bolts awa from Peter, who finds himself suddenly handcuffed to a he wrought-iron table. SLO-MO as the security squad, moving like they are submer try to track her.  She runs like a black blur.  Logan yel for them to stop, his words distended--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooo!  Waaaiiit! Max crosses her arms over her face and hits the window at full run.  The glass explodes outwards in a diamond showe Max disappears into the night, like she was never there. cops don't even get a shot off. REAL TIME as Logan runs to the window and looks down--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He catches a glimpse of Max leaping from balcony to balco down the face of the building, ninety feet below.  She vanishes into the shadows at street level.

dialogues.speaker: ON LOGAN
dialogues.text: watching in fascinated awe as the curtains blow out aroun him in the night wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: END OF ACT II ACT III

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Dreamlike, stroboscopic images of military regimentation. before, drained of color.  Kids at attention in LONG LENS STACK.  One of the children, a boy with blonde hair, pitc forward onto the floor, wracked by a seizure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON Max's hands yanking off a bottle cap, slapping p into her mouth.  WIDE as she slams her back into the bath corner, hugging herself as she slides to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON the other kids, reacting only with their eyes, n breaking ranks as the convulsing blonde boy is dragged aw by uniformed orderlies.  Some of the kids turn to watch a the drill instructor charges forward, yelling. ON MAX in the present, wracked by spasms.  Her body shake with muscle tremors as she clenches into a ball, eyes shu in her own world of pain and memory.

dialogues.speaker: MONOCHROME FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: A HIGH, WIDE shot of the barracks...kids in rows of steel bunks.  All the beds are filled except one.  Young Max, l in the night shadows, stares at the empty bed.  She looks down at her own hand with a look of fear, watching it sha She stuffs it under the sheet. ON YOUNG MAX as she walks down the hall in grey boxers an shirt.  The corridor is dark but light spills through a d ahead.  She approaches slowly, hearing tech sounds and a murmured dialogue.  The high-pitched sound of a medical s MAX'S POV inside the room.  In a pool of halogen light, t blonde boy lies naked on a stainless steel table surround by doctors and med-techs.  We don't see exactly what they doing, but we HEAR the bone saw and we know it's an autop By Young Max's expression of horror, it is clear she thin they have killed him and are dissecting him like a frog. Standing silhouetted between Max and the pool of light is man in a suit, not in medical greens.  He turns and picks a cup of coffee off a steel cart with one black gloved hand... Lydecker. Max backs away, then turns and runs along the corridor... trips and sprawls...gets up and runs on. CLOSE ON MAX, in the present...opening her eyes.  The mor light is painful to her as she gets unsteadily to her fee She leans over the sink and pours water over her head fro plastic jug.  Max heads out into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max emerges and is stopped in her tracks by the sight of-

dialogues.speaker: HER MOTORCYCLE
dialogues.text: the handlebars of which are draped with Kendra's collecti of thong panties hung there to dry.  After a beat, Max crosses to her bike, and removes the confections as she speaks--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kendra...this is a motorcycle.  It's sole reason for being is to go fast.  Very fast.  It was not put on this earth for you to use as a clothesline.  I love you as a roommate and a friend, but, make no mistake, I love my motorcycle more.

dialogues.speaker: DON'T-TOUCH-THE-BIKE, OKAY
dialogues.text: As she tosses the handful of panties at the sleeping form huddled under a blanket across the room, the form shifts, then sits up revealing-- Darren, one arm wrapped around Kendra, who's snuggled nex him, still asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it? He blinks the sleep from his eyes, then, after a beat, recognizing Max--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live here... Guess I don't have to ask what you're doing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're roommates?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stirs awake) Some of us are trying to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't tell me you lived with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a mistake I made about six months before you did.  But don't feel bad. Justine made the same mistake, along with Renee, Jada, Tia, Brooke--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recoils from Darren) Yech...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happened between me and Tia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave.  Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I say something in my defense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody down. As an aerial police drone hovers just outside the window, dives for the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police drone. Max watches as the drone floats past the window, its TV camera sweeping the interior.  Finally, it sails off but before anyone can register relief, HEAR the squawk of a police loudspeaker outside the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a sweep. (getting up) C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Where're we going? As Max and Kendra haul Darren to his feet, he grabs a hat a magazine or something, to cover his nakedness as they propel him toward the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme put some clothes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time. As Max opens the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you wanna end up in jail, let me and Kendra handle the cops. As they bundle him out onto the ledge--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm afraid of--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look down. Max slams the window shut, closes the blinds, and the two girls crack up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a creep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for all his cattin' around, not much of a stick man either. But the hilarity is short-lived when they hear the footfa out in the hallway of a police platoon sweeping the build

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All unauthorized individuals vacate the premises or face immediate arrest. Suddenly, the makeshift door is kicked in and a cop in fu riot gear enters.  He lifts the visor of his helmet, revealing the square-jawed game face of LIEUTENANT WALTER CLARKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies... Max suddenly relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Walter.  What's the good word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just doing my part to keep the homeless problem from getting out of hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read my mind... (as she pours him a cup) You haven't seen anyone trespassing around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh, no. Max throws a look at Kendra, who retrieves an envelope an hands it over to the cop with obvious irritation.  The co takes out the cash, counts it, then reaches for his walki talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventh floor is vacant and secure. (pockets the money) Have a nice day. He goes.  Kendra turns to Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with you?  Every week this scumbag puts the squeeze on us and every week you roll out the welcome wagon like he's family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Just thought maybe he'd like a little coffee with his saliva.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every week. She makes a hawking sound and the two girls crack up.  Of which--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darren cools his heels, along with everything else, out o the ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max?  Kendra? Darren looks up as a police hoverdrone floats toward him.

dialogues.speaker: DARREN
dialogues.text: full screen on a TV MONITOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon guys...

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: another monitor, and another, and finally, an entire wall surveillance screens, half-watched by a couple of bored t in an underground police bunker somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max wheels her bike down the corridor headed for work. Jacinda cracks the door and peers out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool. Jacinda opens the door.  Max fishes in her jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I forget, Theo's check.  I got in late last night and didn't want to bother you. She hands the check to Jacinda, who manages a smile which only momentarily conceals the concern evident in her face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took him to the hospital again.  They gave him some medicine but he says it's not helping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how it is.  You or me get sick, life goes on.  A guy get the sniffles and the world's coming to an end. Jacinda nods, wanting to believe it's nothing serious, th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you, Max? Max enters--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo lies on a mat on the floor, too weak to prop himself His breathing is labored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Playing hooky again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel like the dog's dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably a touch of what's going around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I got, Max.  They put me back on that drug they're giving the other vets.  Only the guy does those cable hacks says the stuff's no good. Max sees that the fear in his eyes is real, then covering

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't believe everything you hear on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he's on the level?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the dealio on Eyes Only.  He's probably some wack rich dude sitting around in a trick-ass apartment, bored stupid.  So he gets off on scarin' the poop outta folks like you-- I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell everybody hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tell 'em yourself tomorrow. Max turns to go.  As she passes Jacinda--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacinda is zipping up Omar's jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, guys are the weaker sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At his computer console, Logan fast-forwards through a vi surveillance tape from the previous day, freezing on Max she approaches the adjacent building with a delivery.  He blows up the image until Max's face fills the screen, her eyes looking right into the surveillance camera, right at him.  He studies the picture for a long contemplative mom Peter enters in b.g., looks over at his boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad you're getting your money's worth outta that tape.  Had to grease the guard a hundred for it. But Logan doesn't even hear him.  He's utterly lost in th image of Max onscreen.  Then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tryin' to I.D. the perp, or a new girlfriend? Logan snaps out of it, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'd just gotten my ass kicked by a size five, I might be inclined to mind my own business. Off which--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max passes the time between runs playing hacky-sack with another MESSENGER, who's showing off.  As she makes a tou return--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad for a beginner. The other messengers are watching the volley as Sketchy r up, out of breath, a worried look on his face, hops the c and skids to a stop next to Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sketchy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up? She spins and does a no-look return with her heel.  The o messenger makes the save, registering surprise at Max's dexterity.  Sketchy snags the bag in mid-air with one han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kinda important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk and talk as Sketchy lays it out for Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You blew off your girlfriend last night, even though it was the big one-oh.  I'd be pissed off too if I was her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not half as pissed as she's gonna be when she finds out why I blew her off... I need your help, Max. Max just looks at him.  Sketchy can't meet her gaze, then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I've more or less been seeing this other person. A beat, then coolly--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see how you cheating on Natalie involves me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're thinking.  But the truth is, this other person is not someone I'm in love with.  As a matter of fact, after what she just did, she's not even someone I like much.  So in a technical sense, I'm not sure you could call me and her cheating...officially.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do guys actually believe their lame, self- serving excuses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or do you think we're just so grateful to have one of you idiots we'll look the other way, which is arrogant and condescending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lame, self-serving, arrogant...guilty as charged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left out condescending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's another side--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it comes.  The part where the guy turns everything around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the victim here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear me out.  This person I've been seeing is a Jam Pony client who happens to be married--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you were a sympathetic ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then a sympathetic mouth, then a sympathetic--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had me followed the other day and found out about Natalie.  Now, this person's demanding I blow her off or she'll do it for me by telling Nat about us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this person have a name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Lydia telling Natalie the truth makes you a victim in what way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a toy to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A toy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's as much as said so.  But she doesn't want to share her toy with anyone else... It's just an ego thing with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight fire with fire.  Threaten to go to her husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who either doesn't care, or could have me killed.  Either way, Natalie's still gonna find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens if you level with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if she doesn't dump me, which is unlikely, she'd never be able to trust me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why should she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Max, I made a terrible mistake.  One I'll never, ever make again.  Natalie and I are soulmates.  I know that now.  She's the woman I want to spend the rest of my life with.  I guess it took the thought of losing her for me to understand that. After a beat, Max heaves a sigh, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan enters, looks around at the motley assortment of messengers, then crosses to the dispatch counter where No barks out an order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick-up at four-eleven Montgomery going to Pacific Heights. He tosses a package to Herbal Thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Normal) I'm looking for a lady who works here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies would be elsewhere. He flashes the picture of Max lifted from the surveillanc video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know where I can find her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she does work here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She may be easy on the eyes but she's trouble, trust me. (calls out) Hot run to two-oh-two Sansomme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't help you. Logan pulls out a bill, extends it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout her name and address? Normal eyes the money, then pockets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max something.  I got no clue where she stays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any idea when she'll be back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wait. Logan plunks himself down in a chair to wait.  Normal see he's determined, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs out after work at a place called Zeitgeist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Max and Original Cindy play a game of eightball--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're actually gonna bail Sketchy out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, 'cause maybe he's learned his lesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlikely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And because he's my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends don't help other friends cheat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And because I actually kinda feel sorry for guys sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're prisoners to their genes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are dogs.
