dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't have a lot of moving parts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one I can think of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, think of the drama I'm sparing Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say hang the bastard out to dry, let her see him for the heel he is, then maybe she'll step to the all-girl team and let mama-licious ease her pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, of course, there's nothing self- serving in that scenario. Max looks up, sees Logan at the bar talking to Lamar, who points in her direction.  As Logan crosses to her--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Logan) So this guy walks into a bar and says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't get a chance to finish our conversation the other night. By way of introduction, without taking her eyes off Logan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Original Cindy, say hi to my good friend--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan Cale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. But Max and Logan just stand there looking at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about your window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we go somewhere and talk? Sensing that it's time to make herself scarce, Original C looks at her watch--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woop, Xena's on. She splits.  Max and Logan look into one another's eyes, transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme get my coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one you're wearing? Finally, Max breaks their gaze, looks down, sees she's in fact wearing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. They head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Logan walk in silence for a moment, an easy affin between them.  After a moment--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you find me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't that hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I s'posed to be flattered by all the attention?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you know who I am, where I live.  I figured I better find out who I'm dealing with in case you were looking to hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now you tracked me down.  What d'ya think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too early to tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does Mrs. Eyes Only like being married to a guy on everybody's hit list?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauren's not my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of my sources.  Her husband was murdered by Edgar Sonrisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your shot in all this?  Being a famous, anonymous, underground, pirate, cyber-journalist can't be much of a payday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fortunately, my needs are met in that department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what, you just like the sound of your own voice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look around at all this... (gesturing at the city around them) Built by people who got up every morning and worked hard trying to make a better life.  Then the bomb happened and everyone got scared.  They blinked and before they knew it they'd given away the store to a bunch of thugs who were happy to take it off their hands.  Overnight the government, the police, everything intended to protect the people had been turned against them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You miss the good ol' days.  Even though there were still poor people who died from diseases when they didn't have to. And rich people spent obscene amounts of money redecorating their houses to match the cat.  Those good ol' days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People had a choice, even if they took it for granted.  And now they don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you gonna do about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personally, I'm more interested in going fast on my motorcycle or climbing the Trans American building with my pals. Instead of giving myself a headache over stuff I can't do anything about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You accept the way things are, you're an active participant in making it worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the social studies class over for today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... They walk in silence for a beat, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a pretty extraordinary display of athleticism the other night.  In fact, a little too extraordinary.  You wanna tell me how-- But he looks up at her and she's gone.  As the CAMERA pul back, Logan is all alone on an empty street, looking for who seems to have vanished into thin air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACT IV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.  Messengers drink coffee and eat donuts as they for their assignments.  Max, at her locker, confers with Sketchy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're straight on how this is gonna go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You set up on Lydia.  When she's on her way over to the apartment you give me the heads up.  I answer the door and pretend to be Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tells you how I've been--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a philandering pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you explain that you're a compassionate and understanding person who can find it in your heart to forgive me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or, I dissolve into an angry, hysterical wreck who never wants to see your lying ass again, which is probably what would really happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't want Natalie to ever find out.  She deserves better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get her out of town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Convinced her she needed to visit her mom in San Mateo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're sure Lydia's gonna make her move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She came by the apartment once already. Fortunately, I'd disconnected the doorbell as a precaution... Lydia's not gonna back off until she gets her pound of flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give it my best shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, what did I do to deserve a friend like you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't. She gets up and heads out, passing Normal, who shoves a package at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen-thirteen Market.  Get a signature, then take it to this address... By the way, that guy who was in here sniffing after you yesterday called twice already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I took the day off 'cause I wasn't feeling so hot. She walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the package) What about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking the rest of the day off 'cause I'm not feeling so hot. Off Normal's exasperation--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia mounts the steps, rings the doorbell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend of your fiance's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To set the record straight about where he was the other night when he said he was working late. After a long silence she's buzzed in.  As Lydia enters--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Max opens the door, we see that her hair is pulled bac a bow.  Her leather jacket, jeans and boots have given wa one of Natalie's floral print dresses.  Lydia enters, loo around at the modest surroundings, smirks--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Lydia.  And it seems you and I have a lot in common.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you knew where my fiance was the other night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With me, where he's been after work, three, sometimes four nights a week for the last two months... We have what you might call an intimate relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know you're telling the truth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He been sleeping in a T-shirt lately? (off Max's reaction which confirms this) That's so you won't see the fingernail marks on his back. (flashes a set of long, red nails) Bet you didn't know your boyfriend finds a little pain exciting.  He didn't either...at first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't know what you want--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was important for you to know the facts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so should you.  Sketchy told me I could expect a visit from you.  I know all about how you threatened him.  That if he didn't break it off with me, you'd save him the trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's over between you and him. We're getting married next month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How sweet.  Standing by your man, even after what he did.  You're a very understanding person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big part of loving someone's being able to forgive them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're also a fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not before we get something straight you prissy little bitch.  I decide when I'm done with your boyfriend.  Not him, and certainly not you.  Unless maybe you want to find out just how sharp these nails really are. She goes for Max's face with a handful of flaming red fingernails.  But Max catches her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not a place you wanna go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of my hand. Max does.  Lydia composes herself a beat, then takes a sw at Max, who easily steps aside, then catches Lydia by the and flips her onto her back on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working very hard to respect my elders here but don't push your luck. Lydia gets up, grabs a floor lamp and, in SLO-MO, swings like a truncheon at Max, who easily ducks it at normal sp Max, fed up now, is on her in an instant. Still in SLO-MO, Lydia's expression registers horror as M collars her, then back to normal speed, drags her to the window and hangs her upside down by the ankles three stor above the pavement below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help... Lemme go... No, don't let me go... Help...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, here's how it's gonna be, Lydia. You're gonna take your threats and your acrylic nails, and you're gonna go home and figure out your marriage, instead of trying to make other people feel as miserable as you do, understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. Max lets go with one hand, holding the woman's full weigh with the other.  Lydia screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say the words, "I understand."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I ever catch you coming near my man again... Off Lydia, upside down, her skirt around her shoulders--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty minutes later.  Present are Max and a triumphant Sketchy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You rock, Max. (jabbing a finger at her) You... Rock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy Sketchy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm serious.  That psycho got exactly what she deserved... Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia may not have been one of humanity's finer specimens but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's toxic...monster in bed, but toxic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing her thought) You would be making a mistake to come away from this thinking she's the villain in the piece... You are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was the one--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of this would've happened if you had exercised even a smidgen of good judgement or self-restraint, which you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuts him off) You were trying to have it both ways and you were being completely selfish.  And if I ever find out you're going out the back door on Natalie again, you're the one who's gonna be hanging by your ankles three stories up.  Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, okay--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say the words, "I understand." A beat, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vogelsang sits at his computer, a half-empty glass of boo next to the keyboard.  The phone rings, he answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Who's this? ...Oh, hey Phyllis, didn't recognize your voice... What's up? ...The usual, doing some work for a client.  Thinks one of his bartender's got his hand in the till.  Kid works three days a week for tips, just dropped forty large on a new ride... Tonight? ...I really can't... Of course I want to see you but-- From the sudden change in his demeanor we can only imagin the word picture Phyllis is painting.  Then, serious now-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you wearing? ...The red one? ...See you in a few. Vogelsang hangs up, finishes off the glass, clicks off hi computer, grabs his briefcase and heads into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deserted.  Vogelsang heads for the front door.  He taps t washing machine lids shut, one by one as he goes.  He hit the lights and heads out the door, locking it as he addre a kid just arriving with a basket of laundry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're closed.  Sorry. Vogelsang locks the door and goes. ANGLE ON a row of oversized industrial dryers.  After a b the door of one of them is kicked open.  Then, in the darkness we watch as a human form, clad all in black, cli out of his hiding place, then goes to another dryer, open and takes out a black bag of gear and heads for Vogelsang office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vogelsang arrives at his car, a 20-year-old beater with a alcohol tank retrofitted on the hood.  He pats himself do looking for the car keys, mutters a curse, then heads bac toward the laundromat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the intruder rifles drawers, etc.  He hears something, freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vogelsang unlocks the door, enters and pads toward his office, banging into the now open door of the industrial dryer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Damnit... He continues into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for the light switch but is jumped from behind the intruder, who takes him out with a couple of quick ch Vogelsang hits the ground hard.  The intruder rifles his pockets, empties his wallet, then grabs his bag of gear a splits.  Off Vogelsang, out cold as the sound of footstep recedes in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max enters, calls--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kendra... Anybody home? But no one is.  Max peels off her leather jacket, drops i the floor.  She kicks off one boot, then the other, then peels off her black turtleneck revealing a tank top underneath, dives onto her futon and sighs.  Not out of fatigue, more like the weight of the world weighing on he tonight.  She lies there a beat, then senses something. it a vibration, intuition.  She sits up suddenly and is v still, like a deer in the forest listening for a predator approach, then she turns and looks behind her and sees--

dialogues.speaker: THE GOLD STATUE
dialogues.text: on the milk crate bookshelf against the wall. Max gets up, crosses to the statue, picks it up and look it a long moment trying to run the math.  then, impetuous she heads out of the room collecting her just doffed clot as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: END OF ACT IV ACT V

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The luxurious apartment, subdued lighting.  A beat, then-

dialogues.speaker: MAX DROPS INTO FRAME
dialogues.text: landing in a crouch.  She sees--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan, standing in the dining room, just lighting a candl the long table.  There are two place settings.  He looks her, then blows out the match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever notice how cats always seem to turn up around dinner time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (icy) I won't be staying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a half bad cook. The tastefully arrayed table suggests this is an understatement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like following me around and pestering the people I work with wasn't bad enough, but breaking into my apartment--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a lotta nerve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?  You're the one who tried to rip off this piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Completely different situation.  I steal things in order to sell them.  For money. It's called commerce.  But some stranger sneaking into a girl's bedroom is...bent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make it sound I pawed through your priceless collection of underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know you didn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So saw my hands off, I left you a present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I s'posed to be grateful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be appropriate, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'm I s'posed to ever sleep there again knowing some pervo's probably touched everything I own?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're that nervous, you're welcome to stay here. Max feigns complete revulsion at the thought as Peter the security guard enters in a rush, drawing his gun menacing some ace wrapping on his wrist and a bandage on the bridg his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa there, Tex!  We've been through all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright, Peter, we're fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are not fine. Peter lowers the gun but continues to watch Max suspiciou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a tactical exposure which I go on record as not liking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noted... Peter, do me a favor and look in on Lauren and Sophy. Peter grudgingly exits and Max causally circles the table She idly kicks the plywood which has been fastened over t window she broke last time she was here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if I made you nervous or uncomfortable or creeped you out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes on all counts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  It wasn't my intention.  But I had to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd think a guy who's taken on the job of saving the world would have a few more important things to do than traipse around after some girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been able to get you off my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to get out more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mere, I want to show you something. Putting a hand on each shoulder, he steers her over to an ornate mirror hanging above the sideboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gold leaf, art nouveau, French, early nineteen hundreds... I could probably fence this for three or four grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I meant this. He points to her reflection in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably the most singularly beautiful face I've ever seen. Max is caught off guard, even a little embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expensive gifts, surprise late-night visits, over-the-top flattery... You always come on this strong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only when I meet someone I have to know everything about. He brushes the air off the nape of her neck and leans in. Max doesn't resist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Logan sees the bar code on her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now I think I know pretty much everything. He abruptly pulls away, leaving Max standing there confus by the interruption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose I could help you locate the other ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other ones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other one like you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blankly) You lost me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Max.  First I watch you dive headfirst out the window fifteen stories up like you're Rocky the flying squirrel. Then, I found this in your apartment. He pulls a vial of pills out of his pocket.  Max register outrage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L-Triptophane...a neurotransmitter sometimes used in homeopathy to control seizures.  Then the lightbulb went off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did go through my stuff. As Logan turns and heads into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max follows as Logan begins typing information on the computer keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got an anonymous report a couple years ago from a guy who says he was a lab tech at a covert genetics lab in the Wyoming mountains... A file labeled MANTICORE fills the computer screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what kind of game you're playing here but I'm out because you are a whack-job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was working on something called Project Manticore, which was using recombinant DNA to produce a superior human...a warrior...an advanced infantry soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that I don't enjoy a good urban legend now and then but what does any of this have to do with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar code on your neck, Max.  I know who you are and I know who you're running from. The revelation freezes Max in her tracks.  After a beat, suddenly bolts but Logan catches her, looks into her face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were a couple of dozen of these transgenic kids.  And in oh-nine, a few months before the pulse, six of them escaped. The struggle goes out of her when she hears this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six? The emotion is plainly evident in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one of those kids, Max. Off which--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauren sits on the bed reading "Goodnight Moon" to Sophy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight Bears.  Goodnight chairs. Goodnight kittens.  Goodnight mittens. Goodnight clocks.  And goodnight socks. Goodnight little house.  And goodnight--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to move away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Honey, but just think how exiting it will be-- new house, new school, new friends--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why can't we stay here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we can't.  There's nothing here for us anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we in some kind of trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how come last night I heard you talking to Logan and you were crying? A beat, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you cry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm sad, or tired, or sometimes when I'm angry or when somebody's being mean to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much the same reasons I was crying.  But things will be better when we move to a new place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'm gonna do what you do to make me feel better when I'm sad. Sophy takes the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to read you a story... And goodnight mouse.  Goodnight camel. And goodnight brush.  Goodnight nobody. And goodnight mush--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan listens as Max relates the specifics of her history

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got separated right away.  I never knew how many made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How well do you remember the lab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember fine.  I just didn't understand what was going on.  They never told us anything except what to do.  It took me a long time afterwards to figure things out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know they made me.  Even got the label on my neck to prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The technical term for you is "chimera"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...a made-up creature.  Like in mythology...with the head of a lion, the body of a goat and the tail of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your basic hodge-podge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly... Max acknowledges the compliment with a brief glance, then looks out the window at the city lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas is a snap when you got no parents or relatives, just a bunch of gene sequences from probably twenty different people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like extra virgin olive oil, the best of the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (then, turning from the window) You said you could help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to find this technician, or anyone else who knows about Project Manticore. They would've used surrogate mothers to carry you after the in-vitro work... If I can track down one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in it for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already don't like the sound of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman you met, Lauren.  She supervised workers removing cortodiazapine from gel caps by hand and replacing it with powdered sugar.  The real drug was shipped out of the country. The placebos were distributed to County VA Hospital and six veterans' clinics in the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's low, but this effects me how exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's prepared to testify that she was instructed to do this by one of Edgar Sonrisa's managers.  You know who Sonrisa is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I catch your hacks.  He's Satan's lap dog, or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you know the lengths he'll go to keep her from going public... I'm turning Lauren over to Canadian law enforcement tomorrow.  They'll put her in witness protection, but if you're with her the risk of her safety goes way down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't make it this far by attracting a lot of attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's put her life on the line, and her faith in me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want me...bad.  Or at least they don't want me grabbed up by the Chinese or whoever.  Best case, I wind up back in that facility.  More likely, it's a long drive out in the country, if you know what I mean. Logan sees the fear in her eyes.  A flash of the scared s year-old through the stony poise of the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've lost track of me and I plan to keep it that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a soldier, Max.  That's what you were put here for.  But soldiers need a mission otherwise they tear themselves up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's deep.  But before you lecture me about the meaning of life maybe you oughta get one...ta ta. Then, she leaps up and grabs the combing of the skylight. She pikes sharply, like a gymnast, and pulls herself up through the opening.  And, just like that, she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max picks up a newspaper, looks around, tucks the gold st in it, hand it to the proprietor, INGA MARCHAND, 28, toug cool, sexy, despite her prosthetic leg.  Inga takes the newspaper, checks out the statue, her eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you clip this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.  It was a present from a guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must think you're pretty special laying this on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought so.  Turned out he wanted me for something else though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same old story. (then hands back the statue) Not interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Thought I'd let you have first crack... Later. She stands to go but Inga stops her.  We get the sense th is all part of the dance, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which means I gotta fence it for two. Who's got that kinda scrilla lying around, these being the worst of the times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I ain't mad at you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you seventy-five bucks for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, then) Later. As she heads off, Inga relents, pulls out a wad.  This is practiced as a Japanese tea ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't do this. (as she counts out the money) But I got a client lookin' to score some fire power.  Maybe you'll keep your eyes open for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get involved with guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make it worth your while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firm) It's a rule. Inga hands the money to Max, reaches for the statue.  But without counting the cash, Max yanks back the merchandise

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're light a deuce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Am I? Then she counts out two more bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Max, what do you do with all your money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got overhead... She goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max pulls up on her motorcycle.  A sign says CLOSED.  Max dismounts, knocks on the door but it's open.  She venture in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She transits the corridor into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is trashed.  Vogelsang sports a mouse under one eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? He looks up at Max, puts a finger to his swollen lip to silence her, then by way of explanation scrawls on a pad he speaks--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walked in on some hump ransacking the place.  Disgruntled former client, or someone I'm looking into trying to see what I got.  Or it coulda been your garden variety junkie boost.  Who knows? As he holds up the pad--

dialogues.speaker: ROOM BUGGED.
dialogues.text: Max nods understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as you're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll live... Regarding your case...I'm afraid I've come up with some bad news on your fiance.  Lemme get the file. He motions Max toward the back door--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need to freshen up, bathroom's over there. Max picks up the cue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. As Vogelsang steers her outside into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vogelsang's demeanor instantly changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what your story is and I don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your money. She hands it to him but he doesn't take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever tossed this place wants you.  And I'm looking to stay outta the line of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's this about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lifted my wallet to make it look like a robbery.  But there's a bug in my computer keyboard, a tap on the phone and a mike in the light fixture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you said, maybe somebody's tracking one of your investigations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardware's too sophisticated.  It's gotta be the government.  And why do I think they're looking for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm you, I take that money and get outta town while you can. He heads back into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resuming his cover story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your fiance has four previous wives.  His M.O. is to clean 'em out and take off. (sotto) Which is what you oughta do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastard... It's unclear whether she's speaking in character or venti on Vogelsang for bailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I couldn't come up with something more positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me both. She goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Max gets on her motorcycle and heads off, she puts her collar up, pulls her hat down, glancing at the two men in parked car who watch her closely as she passes.  As one o the men raises a camera and clicks off several frames, Ma looks away and we--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max emerges from the stairwell into the darkened corridor Omar runs toward her waving a flashlight, making the soun of gunfire and explosions as he wages a five-year-old's w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blam-Blam-Blam, you're dead. As Max tries to wrest the flashlight out of his hands, annoyed--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn that off, Omar, before you get the cops on us. Jacinda emerges from her apartment, calls in monotone--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Omar, it's time to go to sleep. She scoops up the child, turning off the flashlight but n before the beam illuminates her face.  Her eyes are red, cheeks tear-streaked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Jacinda just nods.  Omar wriggles out of her arms, runs i the apartment shooting at an imagined adversary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? A beat, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took Theo to the hospital tonight... He couldn't walk so I borrowed some money and we took a cab but... Her chest begins to heave and she breaks down in sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he didn't make it... He's dead.  Oh my God... Oh my God... Max goes to her and takes her in her arms.  Off Max, comforting the stricken women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: END OF ACT V ACT VI

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: grimacing, tortured by another seizure.

dialogues.speaker: MONOCHROME FLASHBACK, (GENEDYNE)
dialogues.text: In the barracks, the kids surround Young Max, who is spra on the floor convulsing.  They look up in fear as the doo bangs open and a group of guards and orderlies come in. kids are ordered out of the way, but they don't want to g Max up, not after what happened to the blonde-haired boy.

dialogues.speaker: ON MAX
dialogues.text: In the present, fumbling to open her pills.  She dumps ou handful, scattering some.  She pounds them into her mouth

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK CONTINUES
dialogues.text: as the kids are pulled out of the way, protesting.  The orderlies, yelling, grab Max, but-- Zack pushes one of the orderlies and the guy flies back a guards rush in with stun batons raised. A girl springs on one from behind and, quick as a flash, yanks his gun out of it's holster and-- BLAM!  She puts a round into the ceiling, then pulls down the guards.  Screaming at them she waves the gun in an ar and-- They fall back, leaving Eva crouched over Max with the gu The kids join ranks without hesitation...their eyes fierc The guards and orderlies fall back through the door and t kids start to barricade it with steel bunk frames.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, IN THE PRESENT
dialogues.text: Convulses on the bathroom floor.  Her muscles are locked tetanic rigor.  One fist shoots out and shatters the tank the toilet.  Ceramic shards and water pour over her.  She pulls into a fetal position, shaking violently, as she ri it out.  Her head raps against the flooded tile floor.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: The kids, led by Zack are running through a service hall the lab complex.  Jondy and Eva are pulling a stumbling M along. They round a corner and lights blast suddenly into their eyes.  Eva releases Max, who falls to her knees.  Eva fir rapidly at the lights.  BAM!  BAM!  BAM!  A figure steps the lights and fires back with one swift move.  Eva is slammed backward and slides in a crumpled heap across the floor.  The pistol skitters and comes to rest right in fr of Max. The silhouette materializes out of the lights... Lydecker OUTSIDE THE LAB the windows explode outward as the kids c through the glass in a suicide charge, dropping twenty fe to the know below.  They hit and roll, and come up sprint Jondy pulls Max with her as they pelt for the treeline. ON YOUNG MAX running.  She pounds through the snow, towar CAMERA, until she is just a rhythmic blur and-- MAX, IN THE PRESENT hunches against the bathroom wall, he tremors subsiding.  The shudders have been replaced by so Tears stream down her face as her chest pitches, and she shudders with a pain of the soul the pills can't touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max arrives for the day, crosses to dispatch, a sober expression on her face, passing Sketchy who offers--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F.Y.I... Normal's a grumpy muffin this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snarls to Max) Nice of you to join us. Max doesn't respond.  He shoves a package at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot run to 842 Beulah, corner of Haight... And you can tell your pal Theo he just got his worthless ass fired. Not that he cares but the wife and kid might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simply) Theo's dead. A revelation which freezes the room.  Normal just hangs there, not knowing what to say.  Max takes the package ou his hands, goes.  But her attention is diverted by a news bulletin on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on monitor) Two men are dead, and another critically wounded after a shoot-out near the Superior Court Building today.  A police air-remote unit captured this dramatic footage at 9:47 this morning, after automatically homing on the sound of gunfire. A monochromatic AERIAL SHOT of the downtown area.  It is feed from the police hoverdrone, and the image is overlai with some alphanumeric data like the targeting video from jet fighter weapons system.  The image slews suddenly in WHIP PAN as the robot reacts to the first shots fired.  I stabilizes and zooms in on a dark Suburban which is rammi car and trying to force it to the curb.  A second Suburba pulls out of an alley and blocks the car's path.  The car skids to a stop.  It is all seen from almost directly overhead, like a football play. The doors of the Suburbans fly open and four gunmen pile wearing ski-masks and carrying machine pistols.  They converge on the car, firing.  The car's windows erupt wit white starbursts, the weapons smoke and flash, but no sou accompanies the image. Two bodyguards leap from the car, firing at the gunmen. are wearing heavy kevlar vests, as are the attackers.  A door of the car opens and a man emerges, yanking a child onto the street.  He shields her with his body as he star to run.  The image jerks and slews as the aerial robot circles the scene. TIGHT ON MAX...as it dawns on her what she is seeing. A woman has emerged from the back of the car, obviously screaming and trying to reach the child.  One of the body guards shoves her and appears to be yelling at her to run He is shot by one of the attackers and drops like a puppe with the strings cut.  The woman turns and sprints for he life. The man trying to shield the little girl doesn't get far before one of the gunmen runs up behind him and hoses him with a machine pistol.  The man drops, covering the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reacting to this, and to the certain dread that she knows the victims of the attack are. The remaining bodyguard is laying down a withering field fire, and one of the attackers falls.  Another is pinned behind the hood of the nearest Suburban. The bodyguard is hit repeatedly and goes down shooting, crumpling against the side of the car. The SHOT WHIPS dizzily and steadies...showing one of the masked killers, who seems to be in charge, calmly pointin and yelling.  One of the others grabs the little girl and they walk back to the Suburbans.  The one in charge helps with wounded gunman into their vehicle. WHIP PAN, a long blur, then the running woman again.  Dod between cars, almost getting hit by one.  She makes it to intersection and sprints to a bus stop where she leaps on bus just as the doors are closing.  As the bus pulls away from the curb, the gunman runs INTO FRAME and stops, obviously out of breath.  He turns and waits calmly as on the Suburbans pulls up.  Before he gets in, he looks up, directly at the CAMERA.  He points to the others to indic the surveillance robot, then raises his gun and aims carefully. A flash at the muzzle-- The image tilts crazily and starts to spin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was extreme!  Did you see that one guy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up... Sketchy and Herbal look at Max, puzzled by her intensity. The drivers license pictures of the two men appear on the screen.  The one on the left is Peter, the bodyguard Max tussled with at Logan's place.  The other man is Logan Ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Present are the two field operatives seen earlier posted outside the laundromat, SANDOVAL and DOCHNOVICH, being debriefed by a man seated behind a desk.  He's silhouette against white-hot slats of California sun fighting throug partially closed Venetian blinds.  From the black gloved sorting through a stack of grainy 8 X 10 surveillance pho we know this is Lydecker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We been set up on Vogelsang thirty-six hours and so far, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few customer complaints-- the dryer ate my money, rinse cycle's not long enough, that kind of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And three or four P.I. clients.  Strictly run of the mill.  I don't think this guy can help us. The black glove sifts through a pile of photographs taken Vogelsang's, holding the one of Max a moment before casti it aside.  Then, Lydecker stands, paces--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (musing aloud) Twenty-three computer hits from one detective.  He browses Wyoming DMV records from ten years ago, employment files on health care personnel working in the Gillette area around the same time. Then he searches prison records for unidentified males and females approximately eighteen to twenty years old.  And you want me to believe it's happenstance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the pulse there've been how many thousand missing person searches.  This is probably one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And nothing in those searches or our surveillance connects him with Manticore. Lydecker crosses to a wall displaying a row of I.D. photographs of young kids with military haircuts.  We recognize Zack, Jondy...and Young Max.  Lydecker studies photos a long moment, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  He's trying to track down these kids... And we're not going to do anything to get in his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A window, being jimmied from the outside.  It slowly slid open, revealing Max hanging upsidedown.  She reaches in, grasping the window casement with each hand to steady herself, then gracefully somersaults into the room, landi on both feet.  She goes to the door, opens it a crack, pe out, then heads into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dimly lit, dingy, Moscow General, circa 1999.  Max makes way down the corridor, passing a couple of corpse-laden gurneys waiting to be taken to the morgue whenever somebo gets around to it.  She peers into a couple of hospital r at patients being warehoused more than healed.  Finally, sees what she's looking for and heads into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She approached a bed where Logan lies unconscious, hooked to monitors, bandaged, I.V.'s running, etc.  Max just loo at him a beat, a dispassionate expression on her face, th without emotion--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure looks like you pissed off the wrong folks. She pulls open the drawer to the bedside table, takes out wallet, goes through it, but it's empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Nurses beat me to it. She flops into a chair, puts her feet up on the hospital then opines wisely--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coulda told ya.  You take a header into the deep end when the pool's empty, you're gonna go splat.  Law of gravity. And even Jesus Christ himself had to obey the law of gravity.  For awhile anyway. Well, better you than me. She hears something out in the hall, gets to her feet, th presses herself flat against the wall.  Through the doorw we see an ORDERLY approach carrying a tray of meds.  He s as he passes Logan's room, casting a long look at Logan's comatose form, then continues on.  After a moment, Max continues--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one I feel sorry for is that poor woman with the kid.  She shoulda told ya to stick it like I did.  But she bought your crap about "doin' what's right"... dumb bitch. As Max crosses to the window, lifts a slat of the Venetia blinds and peers out into the night--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just so you know, I don't feel the slightest guilt about not watchin' her back.  That's on you, hotshot.  One hundred percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In her NIGHT VISION she sees a figure moving furtively on roof across the street.  She watches as the figure remove rifle from its case, then screws on a scope.  She can mak out the features of a not unattractive man in his late 20 Max turns away, then nonchalantly walks over to Logan's b and begins to maneuver it toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I probably oughta let 'em just finish the job.  Least then you won't get more innocent people whacked on accounta your ambition... On the other hand-- As she wheels him out into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did lay that statue on me. She yanks the toe-tag off one of the corpses and maneuver its gurney into Logan's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which I was able to fence for a coupla bucks--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max wheels in the gurney, positions it where Logan's bed been, then quickly scoots back out into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been wantin' to buy myself a new motorcycle. And ducks into a room across the hall just as a gunman st out of the stairwell, sprays Logan's room with machine gu fire, then vanishes back into the stairwell.  After a bea Max re-emerges into the hall.  Then, addressing Logan--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking about stepping up to a Harley... You take care. As Max heads for the exit past our orderly, who comes run at the sound of all the commotion--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.  Empty.  Then a SOUND as Max navigates through the darkness to Logan's computer console-- command central fo his information network. Max takes a seat, logs on, accessing Logan's myriad data files.

dialogues.speaker: S-O-N-R-I-S-A, E-D-G-A-R
dialogues.text: A file comes up on screen.  Max clicks on--

dialogues.speaker: EMPLOYEES/ASSOCIATES
dialogues.text: and begins scrolling through the file of mug shots of Sonrisa's enforcers, lieutenants, etc.-- a generally loathsome crew--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes me wanna take a shower. Then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo...

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: is the face of the shooter, cold, merciless. Max looks up at a sound coming from down the hall.  She listens a moment, then after a beat she pushes away from console and goes to investigate.  Hearing the creak of a floorboard, she snags a vase off the mantle, raises it li truncheon and continues into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max negotiates the darkness, her back against the wall. Suddenly, a figure lunges at her.  Max ducks, catches the assailant by the throat, pinning him to the wall, about t deliver a cranium crack with the vase when she recognizes Lauren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn... Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't get to her.  It all happened so fast.  Logan had her, and I saw him fall...then Peter told me to run.  And then he...and I remember so clearly, thinking it's me they want.  If I run, maybe they'll come after me.  Maybe they won't think about her... So I ran... Lauren dissolves in tears.  After a beat--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't hurt her. Lauren wants desperately to believe her but can't.  Max presses reassurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daughter's the only leverage they have to keep you quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you help me get her back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'd really like to... Max can't muster the courage to venture a "but" as she lo into the woman's imploring eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...So I will. Off which--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the computer console.  Max indicates to Lauren th mug shot on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shooter who tried to finish off Logan... Works for Sonrisa, surprise, surprise. (reads) Bruno Anselmo.  Born 1990, served in Iraq, dishonorable discharge, armed robbery, assault, assault with a deadly weapon, arson, attempted rape-- your basic renaissance dirt bag. But Lauren is too absorbed by worry to pay attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I give myself up in exchange for Sophy, would you make sure she's okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going that route.  Sonrisa's not someone you make deals with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else can we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said-- This isn't my regular line of work so I'm making it up as I go. Off Max--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A limo pulls up to the gate of an extravagant, faded Victorian manor.  The window goes down and the STEROID CA standing guard addresses the DRIVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayor Steckler to see Mister Sonrisa. The guard shines a flashlight into the limousine, looks inside warily at MAYOR LEOPOLD STECKLER, who squints into blinding beam of light.  After a beat--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need to search the trunk. The driver pops the latch and the Steroid Case moves to t rear of the car. In b.g. a bus rumbles past.  PICK UP and STAY WITH the bu as Max, atop the vehicle, comes into view as she gets to feet.  The bus continues down the block and Max somersaul from the roof of the bus over the ten foot wall surroundi Sonrisa's estate onto--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Max lands and rolls onto her feet in a low crouch. Security is tight as assorted armed personnel patrol the perimeter of the faded Victorian palazzo, where a party i underway.  Max makes her way across the grounds but freez as a mobile robotic security drone rolls across the grass towards her, sweeping the area with laser beams to detect intruders, much as a lighthouse scours the seascape with beacon.  Max dives to the ground just as the laser rakes where she had been standing.  She rolls out of the way as another beam sweeps the ground. She bolts toward the house, leaps and grabs a tree limb, swinging herself upward like an acrobat, barely clearing another beam.  Max scales the tree, then jumps onto a bal and disappears into an open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Max climbs into an upstairs hallway, makes her way to bedroom, pokes her head in, sees it's empty, then continu down the hall.  In b.g. HEAR the sounds of the party downstairs.  Max stops at the sound of voices and approac footsteps, then dives into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where a bleached-BLONDE, late 20's, in a little red dress fuck-me pumps (a look which, like cockroaches and Cher ha survived the apocalypse) stands at the sink readying a syringe.  Without looking up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what it looks like.  I'm diabetic. The blonde looks up, sees Max, who looks out of place in boots, jeans, and black leather jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruno's girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But see tonight wives and girlfriends aren't invited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Cause tonight the girls are here in a more or less professional capacity. All of them work for me, and you don't... Let's go. The blonde starts to move Max toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay.  I can explain... You ever have to do something you really don't want to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How I make my living, what's your point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This. Max hauls off and catches the blonde across the jaw with roundhouse that lays her out cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max emerges wearing the red dress, shoes, and the little working girl purse slung over one shoulder.  Going room t room, Max resumes her search for the missing girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max heads down the staircase to the main floor where the party is in full swing.  Young women mingle with Sonrisa' cronies, yes-men, puppets, etc.  Max tries to look noncha as she navigates the room.  She notices surveillance came placed discreetly around the room.  As Max leans against bar for a moment, one of the other girls, a slightly drun REDHEAD, eyes her appraisingly, nodding approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl, you work that dress. Max smiles and then edges toward the other wing of the ho in order to resume her search.  As she approaches the corridor, a hand catches her by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't rush off. The hand belongs to the hitman, BRUNO ANSELMO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sonrisa saw you on the cameras.  He wants you to come see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess again. As Bruno catches her by the elbow and steers her upstairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: END OF ACT VI ACT VII

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is ushered in as a poker game between EDGAR SONRISA a two other men is ending.  A couple of escorts sit with Sonrisa's buddies, one of whom is the mayor, but he is al Behind him is an array of surveillance monitors, with vie of the house and grounds.  Sonrisa fans his hand on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing better than four queens is... (off Max's entrance) ...five.  Over here next to me...for luck. Max saunters over, and all eyes are on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can see to it your winning streak continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet you can. (indicates chair next to him) Sit. She doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused, intrigued) Not right now?  Okay, when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right after you change your wardrobe, your personality and drop about thirty pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a mouth on a girl so young... (grabs her wrist) ...but my guess is talking is not what it does best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only way you're ever gonna find out is reincarnation... Fact is, you are gonna pay me, and I am gonna provide you with a service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I actually know how this works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna pay me fifty thousand dollars... Sonrisa laughs hugely at the joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm gonna give you Lauren Braganza. Sonrisa stops in mid-laugh.  His eyes go flinty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to others) Give us a minute. (escorts and poker players hesitate)

dialogues.speaker: OUT
dialogues.text: They leave, except Bruno.  When the door closes, he pulls pistol and trains it on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check her. Bruno slams her in the middle of the back and Max's hands slap, palms-down on the table.  He holds the gun on her, slides his free hand down her body, his fingers kneading sheer dress, searching. CLOSE-UP OF MAX as Bruno searches her out of frame.  Max seems utterly unperturbed by what is obviously an intimat search.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you gonna put me on your Christmas card list? Bruno searches her purse, pulls out the syringe, holds it for his boss to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Why I always use condoms. Bruno puts the works back in her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that that's out of the way... You want the woman, here's how it works.  You pull fifty large out of your mattress or wherever, and I make a call to bring her in. Bruno grabs her brutally by the hair, yanking her head ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or we can work on your face with a pair of pliers for a couple of hours and you tell us where she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or we could go another way 'cause your boss seems to like my face just the way it is. Sonrisa is fascinated now by this impudent creature.  He to Bruno who releases her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plan is I call her cell number to okay a meet at a certain location. Sonrisa considers this a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you're a player... I'm bringing you this on a plate, and my fee is just the normal cost of doing business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bruno) Pull the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like this--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it. Bruno crosses the room to a floor safe behind the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how do you get the woman to come to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told her it's just business to you, that all you want is a reasonable solution to this.  You give her daughter back, she agrees to leave the country.  I play the guarantor, drive her down to Mexico tonight, and put her on a train to Brazil or wherever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she bought that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have sincere eyes. Bruno comes back with a handful of ten thousand dollar packets of hundreds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gonna need to know that her little girl's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got my word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gonna want to hear for herself. Max hits the button on the speaker phone on Sonrisa's des and we HEAR a dial tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dials) Look, we gotta keep the momentum up here, not give her a chance to think.  If she hears her kid's voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, Lauren.  We're conferencing in Sophy. Max gestures toward the box that it's his move.  Sonrisa considers for a second, then goes to the phone, presses t conference button.  We HEAR another dial tone as Sonrisa a speed dial button.

dialogues.speaker: MAX
dialogues.text: her back to the phone, concentrating as she memorizes the rapid-fire series of beep tones.  5-7-5-0-8-1-8-3-2-0-3-4 1, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the kid on. As Sonrisa hits the conference button, connecting calls--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's one of Sonrisa's men, his arm bandaged after sustain a gunshot wound during the attack.  Also present are five more of Sonrisa's men who've gone to the mattresses in th wake of the gun battle.  The man proffers the phone to So who hesitantly takes it, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lauren paces, overwrought, talking on a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophy?  Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'm coming to get you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to be afraid of. Everything's going to be alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sonrisa reaches over and taps the disconnect button--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love y-- DIAL TONE.  Sonrisa takes the money from Bruno and puts i front of Max, but he rests his hands on top of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the money) Can you put that in a bag or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get it when I get her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...idea.  Compromise, right?  Bruno here comes with me.  He holds the money until mommy shows up, then we close escrow.  What you do with her after I'm gone doesn't keep me awake nights. Sonrisa considers this a moment, then puts the money in a manila envelope, tosses it to Bruno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deeds, not words.  I need your help. As he wheels himself over to his computer--

dialogues.text: Forty-seven people drowned last night off the coast of Vancouver after paying smugglers twenty thousand apiece to get into Canada so they could get work in order to eat.  Only they got marched overboard at gunpoint instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Maybe we got screwed outta living in a time when we could sit in a cafe, sipping our lattes wearing two thousand dollar wrist watches while we plan our next vacation.  But the world got a whole lot meaner all of a sudden.  Wasn't s'posed to, but it did.  And it's back to the law of the jungle.  You got your predators and you got your victims.

dialogues.text: And you still think you can do something to change that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And whether you want to believe it or not, you already fired the first shot. (then) On another matter, Federal Corrections used to keep records on distinguishing marks-- scars, tattoos.  I did a search and came up with this. He hands her a picture of a bar-code on a man's neck.  Th mug shot--

dialogues.speaker: THE PHOTO
dialogues.text: a handsome kid, late teens. Max studies it, her eyes well up with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was taken nine years ago... I.D.'d as Michael Hanover.  Sentenced to 18 months in the state penn at Rawlins, Wyoming for armed robbery.  He escaped from custody after 4 days.  Hasn't been seen or heard from since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zack... He made it... He's alive... Off Max--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again seated atop one of the towers of the Golden Ga Bridge, the city of San Francisco glimmering in the background.  Max is lost in thought, then after a beat--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it... I always knew he was out there somewhere... After a long beat, she sighs, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, I got Logan on my ass about these people and all their problems and how screwed up the world is and how we gotta go out there and turn the mother around... Like I even care. Then Max turns, looking off into the night sky, her dark flashing, her hair alive in the wind as we--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE END
